title: 點解大部分undergrad CS學生寫code同埋algo都勁過d professor?

replies.msg:
https://www.quora.com/Why-do-most-undergraduate-CS-students-have-better-programming-and-algorithms-skills-than-their-professors


點解我唔覺得係咁

但有個comment我好認同
條友話He is so amazed that the people regard CS as programming.

說實在，明明兩樣野黎。

因為啲professor發明咗啲algo同language等佢哋慢慢drill

學生係reinventing the wheel
而professor係creating something new

programming只係cs一個好少人討論嘅field
但舉足輕重
因為佢係將algo data structure coding theory等實體化實現化嘅媒介

因為prof.係由最原始既野開始學 慢慢update本身既知識 可能會有啲舊習慣去寫code
相反學生一開始就學最新最效率既方法 寫code自然比prof好

programming只係cs一個好少人討論嘅field
但舉足輕重
因為佢係將algo data structure coding theory等實體化實現化嘅媒介


Programming theories (computability, algorithms, principles of programming languages and etc) are important in Computer Science.

programming practically is not very important in Computer Science. It is a trade skill.

點解我唔覺得係咁

但有個comment我好認同
條友話He is so amazed that the people regard CS as programming.

說實在，明明兩樣野黎。


Professor都要有Teaching skills and interpersonal skills，情形好似而家出面啲Post成日都話上頭淨係識9up requirements，咁佢本來就係get paid for 9upping⋯⋯

I meant professors are paid to teach and do research and department heads are paid to 9up (kinda)

better programming skills正常
好多教書既係舊時代EE友，舊時代EE邊駛打曲啫

algorithms就好難比較，algorithms點為之勁？
係咪可以寫倒啲lower bound O solutions出嚟解決ubiquitous problems先？

programming只係cs一個好少人討論嘅field
但舉足輕重
因為佢係將algo data structure coding theory等實體化實現化嘅媒介


Programming theories (computability, algorithms, principles of programming languages and etc) are important in Computer Science.

programming practically is not very important in Computer Science. It is a trade skill.

I will say generic programming skills is pretty important in CS. If you can't do programming, you cannot talk to the computer.

睇你professor interest
如果佢interest 係programming 方面一定唔廢

programming只係cs一個好少人討論嘅field
但舉足輕重

Programming theories (computability, algorithms, principles of programming languages and etc) are important in Computer Science.

programming practically is not very important in Computer Science. It is a trade skill.

I will say generic programming skills is pretty important in CS. If you can't do programming, you cannot talk to the computer.


Generic programming skills are required but you do not need to very good at programming to study for a CS degree. That's why I say it is not very important.

Likewise, one needs a certain level of English fluency to study CS in Hong Kong but I would not say that being able to speak English is very import for CS.
